00016 #include "JakesFading.h"

00018 #include "BaseWorldUtility.h"
00019 #include "AirFrame_m.h"
00020 #include "ChannelAccess.h"
00021 
00022 DimensionSet JakesFadingMapping::dimensions(Dimension::time);
00023 
00024 double JakesFadingMapping::getValue(const Argument& pos) const {
00025   double f = model->carrierFrequency;
00026   double v = relSpeed;
00027   simtime_t t = pos.getTime();
00028   double re_h = 0;
00029   double im_h = 0;
00030 
00031   // Compute Doppler shift.
00032   double doppler_shift = v * f / BaseWorldUtility::speedOfLight;
00033 
00034   for (int i = 0; i < model->fadingPaths; i++) {
00035     // Some math for complex numbers:
00036     //
00037     // Cartesian form: z = a + ib
00038     // Polar form:     z = p * e^i(phi)
00039     //
00040     // a = p * cos(phi)
00041     // b = p * sin(phi)
00042     // z1 * z2 = p1 * p2 * e^i(phi1 + phi2)
00043 
00044     // Phase shift due to Doppler => t-selectivity.
00045     double phi_d = model->angleOfArrival[i] * doppler_shift;
00046     // Phase shift due to delay spread => f-selectivity.
00047     double phi_i = SIMTIME_DBL(model->delay[i]) * f;
00048     // Calculate resulting phase due to t-selective and f-selective fading.
00049     double phi = 2.00 * M_PI * (phi_d * SIMTIME_DBL(t) - phi_i);
00050 
00051     // One ring model/Clarke's model plus f-selectivity according to Cavers:
00052     // Due to isotropic antenna gain pattern on all paths only a^2 can be received on all paths.
00053     // Since we are interested in attenuation a:=1, attenuation per path is then:
00054     double attenuation = (1.00 / sqrt(static_cast<double>(model->fadingPaths)));
00055 
00056     // Convert to cartesian form and aggregate {Re, Im} over all fading paths.
00057     re_h = re_h + attenuation * cos(phi);
00058     im_h = im_h - attenuation * sin(phi);
00059   }
00060 
00061   // Output: |H_f|^2 = absolute channel impulse response due to fading.
00062   // Note that this may be >1 due to constructive interference.
00063   return re_h * re_h + im_h * im_h;
00064 }
00065 
00066 
00067 JakesFading::JakesFading(int fadingPaths, simtime_t_cref delayRMS,
00068              double carrierFrequency, simtime_t_cref interval)
00069   : AnalogueModel()
00070   , fadingPaths(fadingPaths)
00071   , angleOfArrival(NULL)
00072   , delay(NULL)
00073   , carrierFrequency(carrierFrequency)
00074   , interval(interval)
00075 {
00076   angleOfArrival = new double[fadingPaths];
00077   delay          = new simtime_t[fadingPaths];
00078 
00079   for (int i = 0; i < fadingPaths; ++i) {
00080     angleOfArrival[i] = cos(uniform(0, M_PI));
00081     delay[i]          = exponential(delayRMS);
00082   }
00083 }
00084 
00085 JakesFading::~JakesFading() {
00086   delete[] delay;
00087   delete[] angleOfArrival;
00088 }
00089 
00090 void JakesFading::filterSignal(AirFrame *frame, const Coord& /*sendersPos*/, const Coord& /*receiverPos*/)
00091 {
00092   Signal&                signal           = frame->getSignal();
00093   ChannelMobilityPtrType senderMobility   = dynamic_cast<ChannelAccess *>(frame->getSenderModule())->getMobilityModule();
00094   ChannelMobilityPtrType receiverMobility = dynamic_cast<ChannelAccess *>(frame->getArrivalModule())->getMobilityModule();
00095   const double           relSpeed         = (senderMobility->getCurrentSpeed() - receiverMobility->getCurrentSpeed()).length();
00096 
00097   signal.addAttenuation(new JakesFadingMapping(this, relSpeed,
00098                                                Argument(signal.getReceptionStart()),
00099                                                interval,
00100                                                Argument(signal.getReceptionEnd())));
00101 }
